questions.question: She spoke ………………………..
questions.description: We use the adverb politely to modify the verb spoke.

questions.question: I felt …………………………
questions.description: Feel is a copular verb. We use adjectives to modify copular verbs.

questions.question: She can speak English ………………………
questions.description: We use adverb fluently to modify the verb speak.

questions.question: He spoke ………………………… anything.
questions.description: Hardly anything means almost nothing. Hard has a different meaning.

questions.question: A fast train goes ………………………….
questions.description: Fast can be adjective or adverb.

questions.question: The soup tasted …………………………
questions.description: Taste is a copular verb. We use adjectives to modify copular verbs.

questions.question: He sounded …………………………
questions.description: Sound is a copular verb. We use adjectives to modify copular verbs.

questions.question: She looked …………………………
questions.description: Look is a copular verb. It is modified by an adjective.

questions.question: She is ……………………….. to hear from her parents.
questions.description: Here the adjective eager modifies the pronoun she.

questions.question: I am ………………………. waiting to hear from them.
